page.title: 01Lower Bassenthwaite Area
page.content: This pleasant area at and around the southern end of Bassenthwaite Lake is within the Lake District National Park. The River Derwent flows into the lake at the southern end from Derwentwater its source. The A591 road from Keswick to Carlisle crosses the area on the eastern shore and the A66 from Keswick to Cockermouth and Workington traverses the western shore. The small village of Thornthwaite on the western side is dominated by coniferous woodland and open scree fell. The 'Bishop' a white rock is a feature of the fell. On the eastern shore the Calvert Trust run an outdoor centre for the disabled and also a bird reserve on wet land near the River Derwent. There are public walks in the forest and access to the lake. The population is engaged in agriculture, forestry and tourism.
